column2: Dena, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've had sinus & allergy problems for over 30 years.  Started on Allerx more than 5 years ago after the previous drug I was taking was taken off of the market.  Both Allerx, and the generic, kept me healthy and allergy free.  After the generic became unavailable, and because of the high cost of Allerx (more than $150/mos.), working with my doctor I tried several other substitutes, none of which prevented the return of sinus infections and allergy symptoms.  After returning to Allerx, I am symptom free again.  I've never had an negative side effects.  This drug has worked like magic for me and I am distressed that it is no longer available.  The new products don't work.  Has anyone tried compounding the ingredients to see if that will work?

column2: Kathy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had post nasal drip due to allergies for many years. This is the first medication (due to its drying agent) that has actually given me relief.

column2: Miagrrl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This has been the most effective med for severe runny nose and allergies. I got samples from my ent. Finally I got a prescription for it and it was so expensive and not covered in my insurance. Now I'm sad it is on the list of medications being pulled by the FDA...I'm gonna grab as many samples as I can!

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: Mike, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Cornerstone has discontinued making this due to FDA regulations.  It has been the only thing I have found to fight my allergy problems.  One of the main ingredients was grandfathered by the FDA back in the 60's and in February said that if you want to continue making it, it has to go through the FDA approval process.  Cornerstone was not willing to do that.  So now we are stuck.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
Amy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I typically get sick during season changes. Howeve, since i have been prescribed Allerx Dose Pack i have not been sick with a sinus infection. I have come to realize that if something works to make one healthy....fda will pull it or not approve it.  Thanks to our government.

column2: Missy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I recently started experiencing new allergy symtons that included a tickle in my throat (which can best be described as a hair ball feeling) followed by vomiting phlegm on a daily basis.  After the third day of taking this medication that completely stopped.  Unfortunely I ran out of the samples of the medication and my insurance will not cover this medication.

column2: Mum, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is the only medication that worked for me.  Where can I obtain more?  My doctor is willing to write a prescription.

column2: lynette, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I like a lot of others on here have suffered with allergies for years.  The other medications that have worked in the past have been removed from the market due to side effects.  This one is still on the market but is getting nearly impossible to get and now when one of my local pharmacies can keep it in stock for me it costs (w/insurance) $165 a month because it is a formulary. Why does the govt and insurance have to screw with something that works.  I have never suffered side effects from this or the others that I took that were removed from the market and the newer generation drugs don't do anything for me at all.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I LOVE this medication, however... This drug will be pulled off the market by the FDA this month.  Please read this article at the FDA's website for more ino: http://www.fda.gov/Safety/MedWatch/SafetyInformat ion/SafetyAlertsforHumanMedicalProducts/ucm245279 .htmHere is a list of all the drugs, including ALLERX, that are being pulled.http://www.fda.gov/Drugs/GuidanceComplia nceRegulatoryInformation/EnforcementActivitiesbyF DA/SelectedEnforcementActionsonUnapprovedDrugs/uc m245106.htm

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Dried up my nasal and sinus secretions very well.  Experienced loss of appetite and a sensation of fullness.  Lost 9 pounds in 7 daysHad a lingering headache sometimes worse than othersAfter 2 weeks on the meds, begun to have daily dizzy spells (almost like a motion sickness!!)Stopped meds and within 2 days dizziness, headaches and loss of appetite was gone.

column2: jamie, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have very bad allergy problems. Been taking this for a month, works great. I have had the bad dry mouth, try taking half a pill worked for me and while taking the whole pill suffered bad with contipation. It was terrible. Other than that drink more liquids and take half a dose still works and not near as bad dry mouth or the other problem.

column2: Dj, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I just got an email from Cornerstone and Allerx is NOT discontinued:This email is in regards to your inquiry about AlleRx DF. The product had been on backorder for a few months but has been released within the last week or so. Certain wholesalers do not accept product within a certain number of months of the expired dating, regardless of the quantity that we may have on hand. This is why the pharmacies do not have it available. We do not deal directly with the Pharmacies but instead with Wholesalers. We have been doing our very best to ship out all AlleRx related products as soon it becomes available to do so. Please understand that once we ship it, it goes via FedEx to the wholesaler and it is up to them to get it to the respective pharmacies within a timely manner.I hope that I have helped ease your mind about this product being discontinued, which of course is not the case. Please email the Medical Information Department if you have any other questions regarding our products.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: Kel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had to stop taking this medication due to cost.  It did cost me $50 for a 30 day supply, I now have a high deductable and one 30 day supply would cost me $458.00  if I go through Medco 90 day supply it would cost me $1200.00  Just does not seem right.  I am trying Tylenol Sinus congestion and pain instead.

column2: gapeach74, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from severe allergies all of my life and was diagnosed with Minere's Disease in Jan. 2008. One ENT doctor wanted to do surgery (endolymphatic sac decompression) where they go drill into the head and remove a piece of the sphenoid bone so the sac can enlarge when I have so much fluid collecting in my sinuses (which was also causing a lot of vertigo). However, I went to another allergist/immunologist and he prescribed this medication for me and I am doing fantastic!!! The fluid in the inner ear & sinus cavities have dried up and the pain in the right mastoid region has been eleviated. If I get to dry, I leave off the night pill and then start it back when I feel the congestion returning. This is a great medication if given for the right symptoms. I hope it will always be available, because it is the only thing that has helped me after searching for two years for help! The only down side is the cost but it cost society alot more if you can't function and be a productive part of society.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy

column9: I love this medication. It is the only thing that has helped me with my chronic sinusitis. But, it has now been discontinued and my ENT has no other recomendations for something compreable.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I felt like the day time pill put me in a fog and made me sleepy.

column2: otterhere, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given samples of this, and it totally alleviated my almost constant post-nasal drip from VR; however, the cost is prohibitive; my co-pay alone was $40; outrageous!  There is a generic alternative, VisRx, but my pharmacy can't get it?  what a racket Big Pharma has going!  I don't see why there isn't a cheap, generic "drying agent" (anticholinergic) available; 10 mg of a tricyclic antidepressent would have the same effect and be cheaper, but that causes weight gain.  Still, AllerRx WORKS...

column2: Trudy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication certainly has a drying agent. It has dried my skin, eyes, mouth, as well as improved my constant runny nose and post nasal drip. The nighttime blue pill wires my up, so I take it during the day and the white at night to enable me to sleep.  The overall dryness of skin, eyes, etc. as well as the cost of the medication make this treatment very unattractive.  I'm hoping my Drs have another treatement available.

column1: Inflammation of the Nose due to an Allergy
column2: princessdebbie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a horrible sinus infection and massive headache! I went to the Doctor and he gave me a sample of Allerx. WOW!!! I have never had anything that took away my sinus problem and took away my headache. I have seen so many doctors about my allergies and I am so incredibly happy that after years, this seems to work!!!

column2: scarlet1501, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have never had a drug reaction before, however when I took the blue pill at night (only 1/2 pill)within less than an hour I felt "strange".  I felt dizzy, lightheaded, and a sick feeling.  The next morning, I could barely walk from room to room without feeling very sedated and had to miss work.  It took almost 12 hours for this to wear off. The next night I only took 1/4 of the blue pill and although it was not as bad, a new symptom appeared, a depressed mood (I have been on an anti depressant for several years)and this just made the other feelings worse. As for did it work, it did dry up all the postnasal drip.  I had no problem with the  morning yellow pill. I had to stop the blue one.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have seasonal allergies and this works. The problem is getting it. Insurance doesn't want to pay and pharmacies usually doesn't carry it. I plan to spend this summer by the water hopefully next year will be better in terms of supply and demand.

column9: I have been taking Allerx for four years with excellent results.  Problem is I cannot get the Ins. Co. to approve it.  So now I am trying another brand and it leaves me with my nose running constantly.  For me to take Allerx on my own it would cost me$189.00 per month.  Rediculous!  My eyes are swollen, even my nose is swollen without Allerx.  Am I addicted to it??Louise Evans
